title: Wildlife Management
description: Important habitats, such as riparian, wetlands, and habitat features important to wildlife, such as vegetation types and snags. Basic concepts of wildlife management. Emphasis on planning and designing habitats to meet the needs of wildlife. 3 lectures, 1 laboratory.
prerequisites: One of the following upper-division ecology courses: BIO 325, BIO 327, BIO 328, BIO 401, BIO 444, BOT 326, or NR 306, or graduate standing in Biological Sciences
